Indian snack recipe: Ajwain Sev/ Vamu Karallu Servings : 15 Duration : 30 minutes Ajwain is an annual herb originated in India as it's used in dishes, spices and also for health purpose. Ajwain nutrition facts: It contains only minerals such as protein, sodium and a dietary fiber with less cholesterol and good saturated fat. Health Benefits of Ajwain:
  1. Instant relief from acidity and digestion
  2. Treats common cold
  3. Stops pain due to arthritis
  4. Cleansing skin
  5. To ease the ache of ear and teeth
  6. It makes stomach strong during pregnancy
  7. For mouth problems
  8. Fights with asthma
  9. Acts for viral infections and diarrhea
  10. Best for migraine
Today in my recipe I used main ingredient Ajwain/ Carom seeds with besan/ Bengal gram by adding salt,turmeric and baking soda Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Besan / Bengal gram - 1 bowl Carom seeds/ Ajwain - coarse - 1 tb sp Pepper corns - coarse - 1/2 tb sp Baking soda - 1/4 teaspoon Salt - as per taste Oil - to deep fry Mukrukullu Maker/ stainless steel Kara maker Procedure:
  • First make a coarse Powder of Ajwain and pepper corns keep it aside
  • In a medium sized bowl add besan, Ajwain/ carom seeds, pepper corns Powder, turmeric powder, baking soda and salt
  • Add water little by little and make thick dough. It should be lump and must not be pouring consistency
  • Apply oil inside Murukullu maker / stainless steel Kara maker. Put 3 hole small plate inside of it
  • Put dough in maker and drop dough in hot oil round shape as shown in picture. Be careful while doing this process
  • Cook both sides and take out Ajwain sev when it become slightly color changed.
  • Repeat the same process till the dough completes
  • Keep all Ajwain sev in a plate
  • Break them gently by using hands
  • Ajwain sev is ready to serve
  • Evening snack for kids/ adults / everyone at home üè°
  • Enjoy sev with Dal / sambar rice / Rasam / as a snack
